repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.unittitle: Paul Frank and Hans Adler Papers
did.abstract: This collection contains a corrected first draft of the English translation of Paul Frank and Hans Adler's play, "The Golden Ladder: A Comedy in Eleven Scenes."
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Paul Frank and Hans Adler were playwrights. Frank was born on April 14, 1885 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary. Frank was known as a writer and an actor. Notable plays include Adorable (1933) and Three from the Filling Station (1930). Frank died on March 20, 1976 in Los Angeles, California.

Hans Adler was born in 1880 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary. Adler was known for writing poems for the magazine Simlicissimus. Adler was also a known playwright, actor, and novelist and is known for works like Verliebtes Abenteuer (1938) and My Niece Susanne (1950). Adler died in 1957.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a corrected first draft of the English translation of Frank and Adler's play, "The Golden Ladder: A Comedy in Eleven Scenes."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The provenance of this collection is unknown.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Paul Frank and Hans Adler Papers, Undated. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Frank and Adler Papers).
